result.execSummary:
The defendant John Thomas Huber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

CO: Vlack for SRN, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  John Thomas Huber appeared. Case called at 1:07 pm. There is an agreement. ADA Hartung recites agreement. No objection from Atty Harrelson.   Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for Count One, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of Count One. ADA Hartung makes recommendations. Atty Harrelson makes recommendations. Court questions. Court will not sentence Def today. Def to write apology letters, get a letter from agent, write a letter to the court re: why he should not be put on a probation and a copy of assessment to the courts. km  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Appointing Atty Harrelson. km
Pre-trial conference at 09-08-2015 01:00 pm

Bond on file.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Hideaway Camp Ground or employees.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Maintain current mental health treatment and take medications as prescribed.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson,  DF:  John Thomas Huber appeared. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
